html: As with the king of Assyria/Babylon—who rises high in the heavens, then falls to the depths of the Pit (Isaiah 14:9-15)—Jehovah puts down the “rulers of the earth” and certain “hosts on high.” Rulers who misrule (Isaiah 3:12-15; 9:14-16) and alien angels who abet evil in the world (Isaiah 34:4), who had the chance to enjoy the earth’s paradisiacal glory, instead spend that time confined in a “dungeon” or “pit” (bor). After wicked leaders are supplanted by the King of Zion and by his servants whom he appoints as rulers, the earth at last enjoys an enduring peace (Isaiah 32:1; 60:17-21; 65:13-25).
